title: Mojave National Preserve: Kids & Youth
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Kids & Youth             Kids & Youth                    Mojave National Preserve Youth Quail Hunt   Hunting is permitted in Mojave National Preserve in accordance with California Department of Fish & Game regulations. Mojave National Preserve hosts a special Youth Quail Hunt in the Fall. All youth 10 -17 years old who have or can successfully complete a hunter's safety education course and possess a California Junior Hunting license by September 30th are eligible to register.          Park Fun Looking for fun things to do in the park?  Here's some kid-approved activities to try.          Be a Junior Ranger! Check out Mojave National Preserve's Junior Ranger Program         Mojave Maxine Emergence Contest When will Mojave Maxine emerge from her burrow this spring? Guess correctly and win great prizes for your class. Click here to enter.          Kids for the Climate  These websites offer fun ways to learn about our changing climate and how you can make a difference!          Wilderness is Closer Than You Think Get wild! Celebrate the 50th Anniversary of the Wilderness Act by becoming a Wilderness Explorer. Download the activity booklet (PDF, 3.84MB) to get started.         WebRangers Have fun exploring national parks, monuments, and historic sites across the country. WebRangers is for kids of all ages. Hike virtual trails, play games, and earn rewards, all from your computer!
